unit_learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate evidence based best practice management skills for the assessment and management of treating lymphoedema in children (Scientist and Scholar)
Use feedback from teachers, clinicians, peers and patients to inform self-evaluation and critical reflection of knowledge and skill development (Professional)
Demonstrate safe, effective, patient-centred skills and competencies in delivering high quality assessment and management strategies for treating lymphoedema in children (Clinical Practitioner)

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: this micro unit will be presented as a series of well designed learning activities with embedded readings and knowledge checks.

enrolment_rules.description: AQF level 7 in a health degree or recognised equivalent with national registration if required.

assessments.description: Multiple choice questions and short answer

data.subject_search_title: LYMP8007 - Management of Children with Lymphoedema

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit is one of a series of units examining specialist skill areas of clinical practice within lymphoedema and related areas of management and clinical relevance. In this unit you will develop an understanding and insight into how lymphoedema in children impacts an individual and their family physically, functionally, psychologically, and financially. This unit will cover comprehensive assessment, clinical reasoning, communication and management skills to treat lymphoedema in children using complex lymphoedema therapy (CLT). In this unit you will explore latest evidence based practice such as the theory of normal and abnormal lymphatic drainage pathways and patterns identified by Indocyanine Green (ICG) Lymphography for effective manual lymphatic drainage massage, compression therapy, exercise prescription, education, psychological well-being and surgical management. You will be encouraged to reflect on your own development. The unit will assist your development of the Scientist and Scholar, Clinical Practitioner and Professional graduate capabilities.
data.search_title: LYMP8007 - Management of Children with Lymphoedema
